paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports on the TTR gene variant p.Glu74Leu, detailing its clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual case reports.

patients.demographics: Two unrelated Bulgarian families; ages range from 54 to 57 years, both male and female
patients.phenotype: predominantly cardiac involvement, with some neurological symptoms

individual_records.phenotype_details: bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome, ischemic stroke, heart failure manifestations
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband was a 55-year-old male, diagnosed with bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome at the age of 43...

individual_records.phenotype_details: generalized fatigue, shortness of breath, pain in thumbs, numbness and paresthesia in both hands
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The second patient, a 54-year-old female cousin of the proband, was diagnosed with p.Glu74Leu mutation through family screening.

individual_records.phenotype_details: carpal tunnel syndrome, heart failure exacerbation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient was a 57-year-old male with clinical onset of carpal tunnel syndrome at the age of 45.
His two sons, aged 25 and 29, were found to be asymptomatic.
His two sons, aged 25 and 29, were found to be asymptomatic.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed as a carrier of the mutation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient has four cousins, three males and one female; all were tested, and the female was diagnosed as a carrier of the mutation.

functional_data.summary: The variant is classified as pathogenic according to the genetic variant classification recommendations of the American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is new for Bulgaria and very rare worldwide.
key_quotes: This genetic variant, known as p.Glu74Leu, is classified as pathogenic according to the genetic variant classification recommendations of the American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
